definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: What will the weather be like tomorrow, Mac?
sentences.chinese: 麦克，明天天手气怎么样？

sentences.english: The employer sees all want to go mad, the luck of this young man likewise too favor?
sentences.chinese: 所有人看的都要疯了，这个年轻人的手气也太好了吧？

sentences.english: Assume that your luck owe good, even if what you have mastered mahjong skills.
sentences.chinese: 假定你手气欠好，就算你掌握了多少麻将技巧。

sentences.english: Dont stop me now. Im on a roll.
sentences.chinese: 现在别叫我停，我手气正好。

sentences.english: Don't stop me here. I'm on a roll.
sentences.chinese: 如今别叫我停，我手气正好。

sentences.english: I can't wait to test my luck at the mahjong table.
sentences.chinese: 我等不及要在麻将桌上试试我的手气了。

sentences.english: Don’t stop me now. I’m on a roll.
sentences.chinese: 现在别叫我停，我手气正好。

sentences.english: I am a good luck, how to play so hard to win?
sentences.chinese: 我是一个老千，怎么靠手气打牌那么难赢呢？

sentences.english: Mary usually wins at cards because she always seems to hold a good hand.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽老是赢牌，因为她好像总是手气好。

sentences.english: Do you hate to tempt fate?

definition: to pour/to pour down (of rain)/to lay a bet
to win a prize/a successful gamble
gambling get-together/game of cards, mahjong etc
to draw a prize/a lottery/a raffle
to have a lucky stroke/to try one's luck
to draw a tile (at mahjong)/to play mahjong
